name: Bushwacker
instructions: Blend and pour over ice in old-fashioned glass.

name: Duchess
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: LSC RUGBY Electric Gelatin
instructions: Mix ingredients together, pour into collins glasses and chill for 1 1/2 hours. Serve with a straw. Makes 4-5 servings.

name: McClelland Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Mint on Rocks
instructions: Pour over ice cubes in old-fashioned glass.

name: Panama Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Sambuca Straight

name: Splash & Crash

name: Thunder Cloud

name: Tikki Dream

name: Zero Mist

name: C.C. Kazi
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cordial glass.

name: Charlie Chaplan
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cordial glass.

name: Oh My Gosh

name: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
instructions: Stir and strain into shot glass.

name: Citrus Banana Flip

name: Dreamy Monkey
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender (use half of the banana) and blend until smooth. Pour into parfait glass. Top with whipped cream and garnish with remaining banana half.

name: Lebanese Snow
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender with crushed ice and blend until smooth. Garnish with a strawberry.

name: Maraschino Cherry

name: Peach Amaretto
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Pour into parfait glasses. Makes 3-4 servings.

name: Peppermint Penguin
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender with 1 scoop of ice and blend until all ice is crushed. Pour into hurricane or parfait glass. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with a cookie and a cherry.

name: Pineapple Banana Refresher
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Pour into highball glasses. Garnish with a pineapple wedge and a banana slice. Makes 4-5 servings.

name: Pistachio Mint Ice Cream
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Pour into cocktail glass and garnish with a mint leaf.

name: Smooth Move
instructions: Combine ingredients in blender with 1 scoop of ice and blend. Pour into sugar-rimmed parfait glass. Garnish with a pineapple spear and a cherry.

name: Sparkling Strawberry Mimosa
instructions: Combine sliced berries and juice in blender and blend until smooth. Pour over ice into parfait glass. Fill with champagne and garnish with a whole strawberry and an orange slice.

name: The All-American Daiquiri
instructions: For red layer (light rum or vodka, and strawberry daiquiri mix) and blue layer (light rum or vodka, sour mix and blueberry flavoring) combine ingredients in blender with 1 cup crushed ice and blend until very thick. Layer frozen colors-blue, red, and white (whipped cream) - in parfait glass. Top with a cherry and an American flag frill pick.

name: Boston Caribbean Coffee
instructions: Dip rim of Irish coffee glass in lime juice, then in sugar. Pour liqueur and rum into the glass. Fill with freshly brewed coffee. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon. Garnish with a cinnamon stick as a stirrer.

name: Hot Brandy Toddy
instructions: Put sugar in coffee mug and fill two-thirds full with boiling water. Add brandy and stir. Decorate with a slice of lemon and sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Mulled Claret
instructions: Put all ingredients into a metal mug. heat poker red-hot and hold in liquid until boiling and serve; or warm on a stove.

name: Breakfast Eggnog
instructions: Combine ingredients in large punch bowl and serve. Sprinkle nutmeg on top of each serving. Makes 10-12 servings.

name: Port Wine Eggnog
instructions: Combine ingredients in large punch bowl and serve. Sprinkle nutmeg on top of each serving. makes 10-12 servings.

name: Cider Cup
instructions: Fill large glass pitcher with ice. Stir in the ingredients and decorate with fruits in season and a rind of cucumber inserted on each side of pitcher. Top with a small bunch of mint. Serve in red-wine glasses. Makes 6 servings.

name: Loving Cup
instructions: Fill large glass pitcher with ice and stir in the ingredients. Decorate with fruits in season and rind of cucumber inserted on each side of the pitcher. Top with a small bunch of mint sprigs. Makes 6 servings.

name: Sauterne Cup
instructions: Put all ingredients in large glass pitcher with ice. Stir and decorate with fruits in season and rind of cucumber inserted on each side of pitcher. Top with a small bunch of mint sprigs. Serve in white-wine glasses. Makes 6 servings.

name: Winter Cider
instructions: In large saucepan, bring cider and cinnamon to a full boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and add rum, brandy, and schnapps, stirring until heated through. Serve in Irish coffee glasses, garnished with a cinnamon stick and an apple slice. Makes 18-20 servings.

name: Lemonade (Claret)
instructions: Dissolve sugar and lemon in collins glass, then add ice and enough water to fill glass, leaving room to float wine. Decorate with slices of orange and lemon, and a cherry. Serve with straws.

name: Lemonade (Modern)
instructions: Cut lemon into quarters and muddle well with sugar. Add sherry and sloe gin. Shake with ice and strain into collins glass. Fill glass with club soda.

name: Port Wine Cocktail
instructions: Stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Port Wine Sangaree
instructions: Dissolve sugar in water in highball glass. Add port and ice cubes. Fill with club soda to nearly top of glass and stir. Float brandy on top and sprinkle with nutmeg.

name: Adonis Cocktail
instructions: Stir with ice into cocktail glass.

name: Aloha Bubbly
instructions: In tall, slender glass, put the pineapple juice, sugar, and 2 ounces club soda. Stir well. Fill glass with crushed ice and add the wine. Fill with club soda and stir again. Garnish with an orange or lemon peel spiral or whole fresh strawberry.

name: Amer Picon Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Angel Face
instructions: Shake well with cracked ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Bamboo Cocktail
instructions: Stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.
notes: Louis Eppinger of the Grand Hotel in Yokohama, Japan created the Bamboo as a quaff for visiting dignitaries. Eppinger enjoyed great success both in mixing drinks and in overseeing culinary menus during his time in Japan. Think of this drink as a sherry-based variation on the Martini. The original recipe calls only for dry vermouth, but many people like to incorporate both dry and sweet vermouth to render it a little more approachable. The combination of rich, spicy Angostura bitters with bright, fruity orange bitters will impart a unique and complex flavor profile not found in most cocktails. Given its drier character, it makes a superb apéritif, and is best drunk before a meal.

name: Bitters Highball

name: Bittersweet

name: Burgundy Bubbler

name: Cafe Royale

name: East India Cocktail No. 2

name: Eclipse Cocktail

name: Hot Springs Cocktail
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Kir

name: Lake Breeze
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into collins glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with soda.

name: Pineapple Cooler

name: Port Milk Punch
instructions: Shake with ice and strain into collins glass. Sprinkle nutmeg on top.

name: Port Wine Negus

name: Tomboy

name: Vermouth Cocktail

name: Wine Cooler

name: Xeres Cocktail

name: Batman Cocktail

name: Lemon Squash

name: Lemonade (Carbonated)

name: Cappucina cocktail

name: Vodka & Tonic

name: Extra Dry Martini (7-to-1)
instructions: serve with an olive.

name: Pike's Peak Cocktail

name: Xanthia
instructions: stir with ice and strain into cocktail glass.

name: Rum Runner
instructions: Shake with ice and strain over ice cubes into old-fashioned glass rimmed with salt.
